The mixing parameter φ controls the portion of variance within the structured random effect. Thus when φ = 1 the effect is equal to the spatially structured component and when φ=0 it is equivalent to unstructured spatial noise. This scaled specification has been shown to be superior to the often-employed unscaled BYM model and as its name suggests penalizes complexity [41,42]. Additionally, it more easily enables interpretation of the structured and unstructured effects of the model. These random effects account for variables not in the model that exhibits spatial structure and unstructured spatial noise.
